Text:
I've come outside because I can't sleep...but there's
nothing I can do now.

I've finished preparing for the party, and nothing
else requires my help.
All that's left is to wait until my performance...!
Ohhh, why am I so nervous?!

I don't even get this nervous before Shadow Garden
missions!

...Wait, wasn't my anxiety through the roof on my
first Garden mission?

No, even then, I don't think I was this anxious. Or
was I? Wasn't I?
Ohhh, come on! Get a grip!

Seriously... Pull yourself together. You're "Epsilon
the Faithful." You've practiced and prepared
flawlessly for this.

Why else did you spend all that time pounding away at
the piano keys and clinging onto high cliffs to hone
your performance and socializing skills?

Even the way I walk now embodies a well-bred
enigmatic pianist!
It wasn't easy to acquire these mannerisms.

I acquired it through the blood, sweat, and tears of
enduring grueling lessons!
Wait, there weren't any blood or tears...but anyway!
I no longer have any blind spots!
...At least that's what I know in my head, but—
Huh?!
What was that magic I just picked up on...?

And why here in the middle of the city—wait, this
place is actually far removed from the city center...
But still, that magic belonged to a powerful monster!
Oh!

Right there...in front of the warehouse across the
street!

It may be in the middle of the night, but what the
hell is that enormous thing doing out in the open?!
Hurry!
Coming, Boss!
Those bastards... They're obviously up to no good.
...As for that monster, isn't that—

"If you're going to try and catch a basilisk...watch
out for...their eyes."

"They can put you to sleep, immobilize you...or worst
case...kill you in cold blood."

Yes, that's a basilisk—the monster Eta wanted as a
test subject.

That girl... She casually told me they could be
tamed as pets, so why not use them for
experiments.

Anyway, that magic I picked up on earlier must mean
that the basilisk used its gaze...
Hey, what're you doing there...?!
What're...you...
*gasp* Its gaze took out the guard...!

Are these bastards attempting a robbery using the
basilisk?

...This is a sparsely populated area of the city.
Besides the aristocrat's villa where the event is
taking place, there are only warehouses in the
vicinity.

Security is tight, but if they can get past the
barriers like this, they might be bold enough
to use the monster in their heist.

That warehouse is chock-full of valuable items for
tomorrow's garden party.

Thinking about it, it makes sense to use the
basilisk's gaze to neutralize the guards to
complete the heist without causing a scene.

...As far as I'm aware, none of the goods
from Luna, Ltd. are in that warehouse.

There's no harm done in leaving them to their
devices! In a way, it may even be a blessing in
disguise.

After all, it'll mean that some of our rival
companies will no longer be able to serve
their goods at the party—

...Okay, I've picked the lock. The only things we're
taking are the premium tea leaves.
Got it.
No...I can't just ignore it!

It will be a complete disaster if they cancel the
party because of this.

And if the reputation of the party's sponsor, the
MNA, is damaged, then Beta might lose her position...
Well, not that I care about that.

But the fallout of negative press from the incident
will likely also affect Luna, Ltd., which actively
advertises in the Midgar Times.

And even if it means fewer rivals, if I'm unable to
show my ability, I'll never catch the eye of a
patron.

More than anything, I don't want to turn a blind
eye to a conspiracy taking place in front of my eyes!

I'm sure Master Shadow wouldn't allow the shameless
actions of these rogues!

The true identity of the wandering pianist
"Shiron"... Ta-da! Although it kind of sucks
that it overlaps with Beta's Nastume
persona!

...I'll intervene once I can confirm they're stealing
from the warehouse!
